intro: Facelis retusa f. congesta, commonly known as the clustered facelis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy surface. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant.
